page.title: 09LOCAL GHOST STORY
page.content: This is the story of a local{'ghost'. There had been a{convent}near a bridge in the middle ages.One young nun there a novice had fallen in love with the son of a neighbouring nobleman,who wished her to be released from her vows so he could marry her.However her family would not hear of her bringing shame on them.One night he arranged to slip out and meet her brother at the bridge to discuss the problem.This brother had persuaded her to come,by appearing sympathetic,but the young nun's body was found in the river the next day.Her lover claimed that her brother had drowned her in order to save the family's honour.This was never proved but from then on the bridge became known as{Nun's {bridge.}People still see the ghost in {Hinchingbrooke House,}as that was the site of the original convent.
